1:
CIRCULAR 34 / 2000 
 
 
SUB : CARRIAGE OF REASONABLE READING MATERIAL 
 
 
Please refer to this Bureau Circular No. 6 / 2000 dated 24.02.2000 regarding carriage 
of additional items besides prescribed size of one hand baggage. 
 
2. 
It has been brought to the notice of this Bureau that passengers insist on carrying a 
great number of files and other books, magazines etc.  on the plea that these constitute 
“reading material for the flight”.  In certain cases, they insisted on carrying a bag containing 
“reasonable reading material”.  When this was objected by the Airport Security Staff, the 
concerned passengers have expressed their annoyance.  It has therefore been decided that the 
following items which could be conveniently carried in hand in open condition will constitute 
the “reasonable amount of reading material”. 
 
 (R.K.Singh) 
ADDL.COMMISSIONER OF SECURITY (CA) 
for Commissioner of Security (CA) 
 
NO.CAS-7(1)/97-DIV-I 
Dated : 19.10.2000
